name: Amanda Beach 🌱 Faith+Wellness

social_posts.post_text:
Who else has made fire cider this fall?🍁

I’ve seen so many variations of this wellness drink, and I love how flexible this recipe can be! You can adjust to your own preferences and use ingredients that fit your health goals.

Fire cider is a great way to support the immune system, gut health, and circulation. It is a natural remedy against the flu and common colds. Some people use fire cider to help relieve nasal congestion, The variety of ingredients aid the body in various ways.💪🏼

The basic recipe normally includes fresh horseradish root, peppers, ginger, and garlic, along with the apple cider vinegar. There are many recipes that add turmeric root, citrus, and herbs. Find the recipe that sounds best to you and give it a try!

🔥Fire Cider Recipe🔥

Roughly chop or slice the following ingredients:

• Peeled fresh horseradish root
• Red and white onions (remove skins)
• Oranges and lemons
• Jalapeños
• Peeled ginger root

✔️I also added a handful of peeled garlic cloves, fresh rosemary, oregano, and thyme, along with black peppercorns and cloves.

➡️ Layer everything in a jar with a lid, and then fill the jar with apple cider vinegar (make sure the label says “with the mother” - important to the fermentation process) until all the ingredients are submerged.

➡️ Store in a dark, cool place for 4 to 6 weeks, gently shaking every 2-3 days to mix. Then strain out the solids, and refrigerate the liquid.

➡️ To use, add some honey and take 2–3 tablespoons of fire cider throughout the day or one large shot daily to support your immune system. If the flavor is too strong, you may want to dilute it with water. This can also be added to help add flavor and nutritional support to soups, sauces, marinades, and salads as dressing.😋

If you’ve made this before, what recipe do you use? Has it helped you stay well during the colder months?
.
.
.
#firecider #healthyrecipes #healthymama #crunchymama #healthyhome #healthymom #healthyfamily #makehealthychoices #coldandfluseason #naturalremedies #naturalhealthcare #stayhealthy #healthgoals

Need a quick, easy, DIY gift idea?

I threw together a few of these this week for my kids’ co-op teachers this week, and it’s a great craft for kids to participate in as well!

Grab some empty clear ornaments and fill with Epsom salts and pop a bow on top! You can add lavender buds, flower petals, and essential oils to customize them if you’d like as well. To use, simply empty into the bath before a soak, or use in a tub of water as a foot soak option.❤️

This is budget friendly and great for last minute gifts as well.

Have you made these? How do you like to customize yours?
.
.
.
#diygifts #homemadegifts #diychristmas #christmasgifts #naturalhealthtips #wellnesslifestyle #makehealthychoices #budgetfriendly #kidscraftideas #healthylifestyle #bathsaltsoak #spanight #selfcaretips #onabudget #giftideasforher

Still looking for creative gift ideas or just want some new ways to flavor your cooking? Try making these! Use fresh herbs (or sub for oils!)

Seasoned Salts

Gather fresh herbs, rinse, and remove leaves from stems
Add equal amounts of herbs and course salt to food processor
Blend until thoroughly ground
Spread on parchment paper lined cooking sheet and let dry for two hours or overnight
Pour into airtight container and use a pinch or two in recipes as needed.

Can also be combined with a larger container of salt for a less concentrated flavor, or to blend multiple herb salts together.

Have you ever made seasoned salts?
.
.
.
#healthyrecipes
#healthycooking
#healthychoices
#naturalflavoring
#backyardgarden

We made these at a workshop lately and they really add SO much flavor to your food! Even sweet foods use salt, since salt doesn’t just make things salty, but actually help to enhance certain flavors. The addition of the herbs, citrus, and other flavors just brings more complexity to your dishes. These are easy to make and can also be great gifts!

Here are some recipe ideas to try! Let me know if you make any of these!

Seasoning Salts with Essential Oils

• Choose a coarse salt, such as himalayan salts or kosher salts

• Per ½ cup of salt, use a maximum of 15-20 total drops of essential oils.

• Pick the flavor you want to make, and in a small bowl, mix together all the ingredients.

• Store in an airtight container.
Remember, essential oils are very potent, and a little can season a lot.  Start with a small amount and add more to taste.

• Whenever possible, add the seasoning salt at the end of cooking to preserve the essential oils’ therapeutic benefits.

Oriental Seasoning Salts
4 Drops Lemongrass
2  Drops Ginger
5 Drops Coriander
3 Drops Black Pepper
3 Drops Clove
2 Drops Star Anise

Italian Seasoning Salts
4 Drops Oregano
4 Drops Rosemary
4 Drops Thyme
4 Drops Basil
Add ½ tsp dried rosemary (optional)

Citrus Seasoning Salts
5 Drops Lemon
5 Drops Lime
Add ½ tsp lemon zest (optional)

Herbal Seasoning Blend
5 Drops Thyme
5 Drops Oregano
5 Drops Rosemary
1 tsp dried oregano, rosemary, or thyme (optional)

.
.
.
#seasonedsalts #healthyfoods #essentialoils #doterra #healthymama #healthymom #crunchymama #crispymama #wellnesslifestyle #healthierchoices #healthyhome #healthyfamily #naturalmom #naturalmama #healthymom #makehealthierchoices #flavorful

When you feel a tickle in your throat, you know it could either be just an annoying concern, or it could get much worse quickly. I love that there are simple solutions that can help soothe a sore throat quickly!

One of these options is to make tea and add some “wellness syrup” made with honey and the essential oils of your choice.

I make small batches with different oils to address different concerns. Use only 1/4 cup or less of honey, and then add 1/4 tsp to an 8os mug of tea and stir. You can also just take 1/4tsp straight without mixing it with hot water or tea.

Allergy Wellness Syrup
• 3 drops lemon
• 3 drops lavender
• 3 drops peppermint
• 2 drops frankincense
• 2 drops rosemary

Immune Support Wellness Honey
• 2 drops cinnamon
• 2 drops clove
• 3 drops orange
• 2 drops frankincense
• 1 drop thyme

Cough and Cold Wellness Syrup
• 3 drops cardamom
• 3 drops peppermint
• 2 drops marjoram
• 2 drops frankincense
• 3 drops lemon

**Use ONLY food grade essential oils to make this recipe!❤️

Have you ever made wellness syrups?
.
.
.
#doterra #healthyhome #healthymom #healthierchoices #crunchymom #makehealthychoices #naturalmama #naturalmom #crunchymama #healthymum #doterrauk #doterrabrasil #doterraaustralia #healthyhabits #dailyhealth #wellnesslife

This is one of my favorite ways to help support my kids’ respiratory systems whenever they start coughing and their noses start running. This is so simple and easy and works so well because it’s using the benefits of steam + essential oils to help relieve respiratory concerns.

• Dampen a washcloth with hot water, then place in a quart mason jar.
• Add essential oils to the cloth, maximum of 3-5 drops.
• While seated, have the child hold the mouth of the jar over his/her nose and mouth and have them breathe in deeply, and then exhale.
• I usually have my kids do this for about 5 deep breaths and then let them take a break. You can heat up the cloth again by running it under hot water (no need to add more oils) and repeating this process. Sometimes I’ll have my kids just hold the jar in their laps while they watch a show so they continue to get the benefits of the steam and oils in a less direct capacity.

Some of the oils I like to use for this:
Lemon - dries up mucus and supports immune system
Ginger - dries up mucus and helps with lung support
Any of the Fir oils (siberian fir, douglas fir, black spruce) - opens airways, cleansing, purifying
Frankincense - respiratory support, opens airways
Cardamom - helps soothe the spasmodic response
Spearmint - gentle and refreshing. Just one drop is usually enough of this one.
Thyme - helps break up congestion and fights threats

As always, if your child experiences discomfort, discontinue immediately. Because this is more of a direct application, I choose to avoid using stronger menthol oils such as peppermint and eucalyptus. I don’t suggest this for kids under the age of 3, simple because it might be hard for them to hold the jar.

Have you tried this?
.
.
.
#doterra #essentialoils #healthykids #healthyhome #healthymama #crunchymama #naturalmama #healthymum #naturaloptions #naturalmother #motherhoodunplugged #motherhood #healthyfamilies

My son developed eczema as a baby, after a round of “just in case” antibiotics in the NICU damaged his gut health. For years afterward, we looked for solutions that would soothe his skin without causing other adverse effects on his little body. As a breastfeeding mom, I eliminated dairy and wheat from my diet to limit his exposure to potential irritants. I used infant probiotics and many topical creams, ointments, and salves, trying to reduce his discomfort and heal his body.
 
Although these only led to minimal improvements, I kept looking for a solution that would get to the root of this concern. I knew improving his gut health would address the issue from the inside, but I also wanted something that would truly soothe, nourish, and repair his skin topically as well.
 
Yarrow|POM is what has been the most effective topical application I’ve found in supporting his skin health. When I started using it, I could tell a difference in only a few days, and after just a week or two there was incredible improvement. His toenails even went from flaky and brittle to strong and healthy as we used this on his feet, ankles, toes, arms, legs, and hands - everywhere we saw the patches of red, dry, cracked skin.
 
Since then, any time he’s had a flare (thankfully they’ve always been mild in comparison with when he was younger and only happens when he isn’t as careful with his diet and eats more sugar, dairy, and bread than normal, or when he uses harsher hand soaps while traveling) we’ve grabbed this bottle and have been able to restore the health of his skin quickly.
 
This blend is incredibly soothing because of the pomegranate oil that is combined with the yarrow essential oil. It never burns and gives him such relief. I’m so thankful we have this to support him when he needs it!

Please ask any questions you have! I know a lot of parents struggle with this concern. So thankful there are natural options available to us.
.
.
.
#essentialoils #healthyhome #healthyfamilies #healthykids #healthierchoices #healthymama #makehealthychoices #guthealth #healthyskin #crunchymama #naturalmama #organicmom #naturalmom #naturalmomma #crunchymomma

It’s been a little over a year since I put the brakes on my relationship with hustle culture.

I’ve had to unlearn a lot of what I had been told defined success, and realize that maybe my role with the work God had given me to do was for a different outcome than I had planned. Realizing that advice I had been following and giving others was empty and didn’t honor God’s word 

Hustle culture tells us that if we do more of the right kinds of work, we will get ahead, we can achieve our dreams. 

Hustle culture measures value in income earned, in self promotion, in tasks accomplished daily.

Hustle culture says to make sacrifices now to come out on top later on.

Hustle culture is a creature that is never satisfied. It is impossible to do enough or achieve enough to satiate its appetite.

Hustle culture promotes endless books and trainings that promise happiness and success if you simply learn one more skill or uplevel your mindset just a bit more. To depend on your own inner wisdom, resources, and clever affirmations to convince yourself that you’re on the right track.

But God has been teaching me to seek Him to know what to do with the time, energy, and resources He has given me. I’ve had to step back and re-learn that life’s value is not contingent on what can be produced, created, or achieved. That my time spent on “work” isn’t better than time being still and in prayer, waiting for wisdom and direction for the next step.

Learning that sometimes what looks like doing nothing from the outside means that hard and necessary work is being done where no one can see.

Learning that waiting and listening is as important as any other skill.

Learning that the best way to do any work is doing it the way God is calling you to do it. By looking to Him first each day, to know how He is calling you to serve the people He is bringing into your life.

Learning that God can go beyond what I think are my strengths and give me new ideas and insight and direction that may lead me in ways I didn’t expect.

His plans are always best, His ways are always good. So thankful that He helps us when we need it and shows us the way to go when we seek Him.

What is He teaching you today?

With the amount of tacos we eat in our home on a regular basis, it made more sense for me to make a large batch of our own seasoning instead of always buying the seasoning packs from the store. 😅 Those seasoning blends also contain ingredients that could potentially be digestive irritants, so I’m happy to avoid those and still get amazing flavor for my food!🙌🏻

When you make your own seasoning blends, you control what ingredients you use! You can adjust the spices in the blend to your own preference, and you also decide the quality of the spices you want in your food. This is a simple swap that can help make your meals just that much healthier!

In my Taco Seasoning blend I use equal parts of:

Chili Powder
Ground Black Pepper
Ground Cumin (Comino)
Garlic Powder
Onion Powder
Ground Oregano

I don’t add salt to this blend of seasonings, I personally prefer to salt the food separately.😉

What spices would you choose for your taco seasoning? Do you go for more spicy or more mild flavor? Share your tips in a comment below!
.
.
.

Foaming Hand Soap DIY!

This is so easy to make and customize to your own preference!

Basic Recipe:

Fill foaming pump dispenser ¼ full with castille soap
Add 10 drops Vitamin E oil
Add 20 drops essential oils of choice
Fill the rest of the way with water (leave room at the top)
Replace the top and that’s it!

In this version I used 10 drops eucalyptus and 10 drops lavender oil. There are many other combinations that would work - here are some recipe options you could try!

Anthropologie Blend
5 Drops Grapefruit
5 Drops Geranium
5 Drops Lime
5 Drops Black Spruce

Vanilla Sugar Cookie
10 Drops Vanilla
5 Drops Cedarwood
5 Drops Cardamom

Fresh Linen
5 Drops Eucalyptus
5 Drops Lavender
3 Drops Coriander
3 Drops Tea Tree
2 Drops Peppermint

Lemonade
10 Drops Lemon
5 Drops Basil
5 Drops Spearmint

What are your favorite oils to use in your hand wash? Have you made your own before?

These foaming pump bottles are from Oil Life!
.
.
.

Ranch Seasoning Recipe:

1 ½ cup dried parsley
½ cup garlic powder
½ cup dried chives
¼ cup onion powder
Scant ¼ cup ground black pepper
2 ½ TBSP coarse salt
2 TBSP dried dill

1. Add everything to medium bowl and mix well. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months.

2. If you’d like to add dairy to this recipe, include an additional 1 ½ cup buttermilk powder

3. Homemade Ranch Dip Mix: Stir together ¼ cup ranch seasoning mix recipe with 1 cup sour cream (or plain Greek yogurt) and 2 tablespoons of milk. Add 1-2 tablespoons lemon juice to taste.

Uses:

• Add to any recipe that calls for a ranch seasoning packet
• Sprinkle over veggies such as squash or potatoes
• Season crockpot beef roast
• Sprinkle over chicken or fish
• Use as dip or dressing

✔️Don’t complicate the recipe! Every ingredient can be adjusted to your own preference and you’ll love being able to grab this when you need it for any recipe! Comment below and tell me what you use ranch seasoning for!⬇️
.
.
.
#healthyrecipes #healthierchoices #makehealthychoices #healthyhome #ranch #homemade #healthymom #naturalmom #crunchymom #naturalmama #crunchymama #organicmama #organicmom #healthymum #healthyswaps #simpleswaps #ditchandswitch

Making your mayo at home is so easy and a great healthy swap! Store-bought mayo usually contains soybean oil, which is highly inflammatory, along with other unnecessary ingredients. You can even add your own flavorings and season your mayo to fit your preferences, plus it can save you money compared to buying the premade healthier versions. Have you ever made your own mayonnaise?

Full recipe for homemade mayo:

1 large egg (at room temperature)
1 cup light tasting vegetable oil (I used avocado)
1 tablespoon lemon juice (I used half a lemon)
½ teaspoon salt
½ teaspoon white wine vinegar
¼ teaspoon dijon mustard

Add ingredients one at a time to wide mouth jar. Use an immersion blender to blend thoroughly, should take about 3-5 minutes. Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
.
.
.

I’ve been using this hack with my On Guard detergent for years now and it’s such a great way to make CLEAN detergent so affordable!

Because doTERRA’s detergent is concentrated, only a tablespoon is needed per load! Buuut sometimes I’m the worst at measuring and use more than needed.🙈
.
This tip helps me stretch my detergent so it lasts for 64+ loads!
.
Simple split a bottle of doTERRA laundry detergent between three 32oz pump bottles (you can find those on amazon), then add water!
.
Someone much better at math than me figured out that it takes about 5-6 pumps for a regular washing machine and 3-4 pumps for a high efficiency machine.🙌🏻
.
How important is it to you to use non toxic personal care products? DoTERRA’s detergent is plant based and contains enzymes that help break down organic substances (oils from your body, swear, food stains), along with the On Guard blend to support our wellness.
.
Have you swapped out your detergent for a non toxic option yet?
.
.
.
#doterra #essentialoils #doterraoils #doterraessentialoils #oilylifemadesimple #oilymama #oilylifestyle

Sourdough bread is one of the oldest superfoods. It has been a staple that has helped humans thrive for thousands of years. It’s older than many of today’s “health foods” including kefit, kale, broccoli, sauerkraut, and kombucha!

If you’re curious about what makes sourdough so amazing, here are 7 health benefits!
.
7 health benefits of sourdough⤵️
.
1. Supports gut health - refer to benefits 2-7 on why
2. Easy to digest because sourdough fermentation degrades gluten, fodmaps, plant defense chemicals and ultimately removes sources of inflammation
3. Unlocks micronutrients like vitamins and minerals because it reduces plant defense chemicals like phytic acid and lectins
4. Boosts prebiotic fiber which is food for our gut bacteria
5. Boosts antioxidants like polyphenols
6. The glycemic index is lowered
7. Rich in macronutrients like complex carbs, fiber, and protein
.
Do you like to eat sourdough? Have you tried making it?
.
*Note: everyone’s dietary needs vary from one person to another. As always, moderation is key, and listen to your body to see if this is something you can tolerate!
.
.
.
#sourdough #homemade #homebakers #homemakers #stayathomemom #stayathomewife #sahm #wahm #naturalmom #naturalmother #crunchymom #healthymama #sourdoughbread #naturalmama #crunchymama #holisticmama #organicmom #organicmama #naturalmum

Sometimes when it’s rainy or gloomy outside, I start to feel a little slow and gloomy too, so I love being able to diffuse oils to boost my mood and my energy levels!

Citrus oils are invigorating, uplifting, and energizing. It’s like sunshine in a little bottle! Some of my favorites to diffuse are orange, lemon, lime, and grapefruit.

Floral oils are calming, soothing, and so gentle and can help relieve stress and anxious feelings. I like diffusing these with citrus oils to create an uplifting, soothing, peaceful atmosphere. Floral oils I diffuse include lavender, palmarosa, roman chamomile, rose, geranium, and ylang ylang.

Mint oils help create a fresh, clean atmosphere. They can help you wake up and feel alert and stay focused throughout the day. These blend well with citrus oils too! Some mints I like to diffuse include peppermint, spearmint, and bergamot mint.

If you have animals at home just remember that before diffusing, check to be sure your oils are safe to be used around pets! In general, animals are more sensitive to fragrances, including artificial scents from plug-ins and room sprays, and also essential oils.

Here are some blends to try using these oils!

Orange Dream
4 Drops Orange
3 Drops Lavender

Citrus Sunshine
4 Drops Orange
4 Drops Lemon
2 Drops Lime

Citrus Mint 
5 Drops Lime
5 Drops Spearmint
2 Drops Lemon

Soft and Sweet
3 Drops Grapefruit
3 Drops Lavender
3 Drops Roman Chamomile

Rise and Shine
5 Drops Peppermint
5 Drops Orange

Floral Bouquet
3 Drops Lavender
2 Drops Ylang Ylang
1 Drop Roman Chamomile
2 Drops Grapefruit

Crisp and Clean
5 Drops Peppermint
4 Drops Lemon
1 Drop Lavender

Orange Grove
4 Drops Orange
1 Drop Geranium
3 Drops Grapefruit

What are your favorite scents to use on dreary days?
.
.
.
#crunchymama #healthymama #healthyhome #healthychoices #organic #naturalmom #naturalmama #healthyfamily #healthykids #crunchylife #crunchylifestyle #naturallifestyle #essentialoils #doterra #diffuserblends #holisticmom

Hope is found at the foot of a blood-soaked Cross.

It is found in Jesus Christ.
Fully God, fully man
Taking the full weight of judgment for sin, conquering death, and rising victorious to reign forever.

In Him alone, the One who lived a perfect life, free from sin, there is salvation and hope for life eternal.

In my place condemned He stood
Sealed my pardon with His blood

Guilty vile and helpless we
Spotless Lamb of God was He
Full atonement can it be

Lifted up was He to die
“It is finished!” was His cry
Now in heaven exalted high

When He comes, our glorious King
All His ransomed home to bring
Then anew this song we’ll sing

Hallelujah, what a Savior

Happy Resurrection Sunday.
.
.
.

Want a natural and safe way to get longer, fuller lashes and brows? This is a simple DIY recipe that uses completely natural ingredients and ditches all the toxins found in many brands of lash and brow serum.

Lash and Brow Serum Recipe

Ingredients:
Castor Oil
Sweet Almond Oil
Vitamin E Oil

Fill an empty mascara tube halfway with sweet almond oil and add 10 drops vitamin E oil. Fill the rest of the way with Castor oil and mix thoroughly.

To use, just apply in the evening after your usual skincare routine. These ingredients are gentle and safe for the skin and will absorb quickly!

Bonus Tip!
If you’d like, you can use a drop or two of lavender or rosemary essential oil in this as well, these both help boost hair growth.

Have you made your own lash or brow serum?

#healthyhome #healthychoices #naturalskincare #organicmama #naturalmama #naturalmother #healthymom #healthyskin #lashserum #browserum #ditchandswitch #crunchymama #crunchymom #organiclifestyle #organicliving #naturalliving #naturallifestyle #healthandwellness #wellnesslifestyle

Challenging myself to be more intentional about my wellness routine, which includes getting a diffuser going at some point during the day! Often I try to do this first thing in the morning, but there are many days I forget completely 🫣 or remember halfway through the day. I can tell a difference in my own mood and the atmosphere in my home when I’m using my diffuser, and my husband has even told me that when he’s not feeling well, just having a diffuser going has helped him feel more improved in a short amount of time.🙌🏻
.
I know sometimes I feel so uninspired when it comes to trying to decide what to diffuse, so I created this journal full of blends to help me stay on track with this wellness habit by making it that much easier to grab a few oils without having to think too much about it. I added space to remind me what the blend smelled like, and as a place to add any customizations I made that day.

My goal is to do every blend in this book and make notes along the way! I’ll be sharing them with you as well, and I’d love to know if you give them a try!
.
The book is available at @oil.life!😊

Are you consistent with diffusing daily? Do you think a journal like this would be helpful for you?
.
.
.

.
Just grab your liquid soap, some coconut or almond oil, and Yarrow|POM and add to a foaming pump container and you’re all set!☺️

Reposting one of my most controversial videos. 😅😆 but it’s that time of year again and this has helped minimize the amount of “drain flies”/gnats/fruit flies that seem to show up during the warmer months.

A couple of tips!!
**DO NOT do this daily. Once a month would work, and in between simply pour a cup of vinegar once a week for maintenance.

**if you are nervous about whether your pipes can handle boiling water, you can let your water cool a bit before doing this and it will still help!

**an alternative to this would be using a plant-based enzyme cleaner to help break up old food and other waste in the drain that the flies lay eggs on. Follow up with vinegar and hot water.

Have you tried any of these methods to get rid of flies? What has worked for you?
.
.
.
#healthyhome #pestcontrol #toxinfreeliving #crunchymama #naturalmama #organicmama #organicmum #healthymom #healthierchoices #makehealthychoices #cleanhome #homecleaning

Hey mama

The work you’re doing matters.

It is hard and holy work.

It is a gift. It is a gauntlet. 

It is a valley and a mountaintop. 

It is precarious and precious

a door that opens to a deeper understanding of grace, day by day.

Nothing can replace you in the life of your child.

Your child will be without you longer than they are with you.

The days are long but the years are truly short.

Lord, help me to remember the incredible value and blessing of motherhood. Help me appreciate the challenges and the joys that come with this season. Help me to learn to lean into You in the hard and be grateful in the good.

Happy Mother’s Day❤️

#motherhoodunplugged #christianmama #christianmom #christianwoman #prayingwoman #mothersday #happymothersday #mothersday2023 #trustjesus #saltandlight #cityonahill #joyfulmotherhood #christianmother #hardandholy

This is for you if you want to replace toxic, harsh cleaning products with more gentle options that still work! This recipe contains gentle cleaning ingredients that will still leave your surfaces clean and shiny without exposure to harsh chemicals. I even let my 10yo use this to clean our bathroom counters and sinks the other day, and it worked so well! Have you ever made scouring powder? 

Scouring Powder Ingredients:
¼ cup Baking Soda
2 tablespoons Washing Soda
2 tablespoons non GMO citric acid
2 tablespoons kosher salt
10 drops EO of choice (I used lemon)

Instructions

Pour ingredients into jar or bowl.
Mix or stir until well mixed.
Store in an air tight container and add a shaker lid for easy use.

To Use:
Lightly wet surface with water (I use a spray bottle to spritz the area beforehand)
Sprinkle powder on and let sit 2 minutes
Scrub with sturdy brush or wipe with damp cloth 
Rinse with water or vinegar

Let me know if you make this and what you think! Or if you use a different recipe for scouring powder tell me in the comments below!

Follow up from my stories yesterday! I love taking my kids swimming when it’s hot outside, but I also want to minimize their exposure to chlorine.🥺🙈

When chlorine combines with sweat, mucus, and the natural oils on our skin, byproducts are created that can affect lung health and cause allergies to flare. Additionally, sunscreen containing toxins also mixes with the chlorine creating additional health risks for the liver and nervous system.

Vitamin C has the ability to neutralize chlorine, and making an after swim spray can help reduce some of the effects of being exposed to those chemicals for a prolonged period of time. Powdered vitamin C can be added to water in a spray bottle and applied after swimming to the skin and swimsuits.

A few other ways to reduce exposure and effects of chlorine:
• Taking extra vitamin C on swim days can also help support health from the inside out or eat extra vitamin C rich foods.
• Showering before and after swimming (use the swim spray first, then rinse off), and rinse hair well each time.
• Soaking in a bath with epsom salt + vitamin C powder after swimming.
• Make a roller with geranium EO and apply to the bottoms of the feet after swimming. Use 10 drops of geranium in a 10ml and the rest carrier oil. Can also add a drop or two of geranium to Epsom salts before adding to the bath

We LOVE being able to cool off at the pool in the summer heat, and I’m so thankful we can still enjoy activities we love while still supporting our health! As always, do your research and choose what’s best for your family. This is not medical advice, be sure consult a trusted provider with any questions or concerns.❤️

Do you enjoy swimming in the summer 🏊🏼‍♀️😄🙌🏻
Do you prefer pools or natural bodies of water 😍💧

I’ve been watching the Lord unfold some pretty amazing things over the last few months, and it just helps me to realize again, that His plan is always better than the one I’ve come up with. I can give EVERYTHING to Him to work out in His perfect timing. When I rely on my own understanding I only end up confused, frustrated, and disappointed. When I grow impatient and try to figure things out in my own strength and wisdom, the result is never what I hoped it would be. I end up listening to people instead of to Him alone. I end up seeking out bad advice and worldly wisdom, thinking that surely there must be a shortcut to getting what I think is best. But God alone knows what is truly best for me. I am learning to wait on His timing and His direction before making decisions, having conversations, starting projects, and so much more. I can go to Him with the big things and the small things. He is present in every part of life, He is working things out beyond what I can see. I can fully trust Him because He never fails. He keeps every one of His promises.

Friends, learn to listen to the still, small voice of His Spirit that sometimes tells us to wait longer than we are comfortable waiting. That sometimes tells us to be quiet when we think we’re supposed to speak. That sometimes tells us to be still when we think we’re supposed to work. He will give you an answer in His perfect timing. He will help you know the way to go.

Psalm 145:18-19
The Lord is near to all who call on Him,
To all who call on Him in truth.
He fulfills the desire of those who fear Him;
He hears their cry and saves them.

Do you struggle with waiting on God’s timing for the things you are praying about? Let me encourage you. He is listening. He is present as you seek Him. Keep pressing into Him. Release every worry, every care, every frustration into His arms and lean into His peace.
.
.
.

One of my favorite things is getting up early and finding a place to do my quiet time and watch the sun come up. There’s just something so special about starting my day with quiet reflection as I watch the new day begin.
.
I realize that if you are at home with little ones, you may have a hard time getting enough rest as it is, so this is definitely *not* something more important than getting adequate rest, but instead something to consider adding into your routine as your babies grow and start sleeping in past 6am (I still have one who gets up at 6:30, so this is actually a pretty rare treat for me).
.
For a long time, I took my youngest with me on morning walks in the stroller while I listened to worship music and prayed as we walked around the block a couple times. Even going outside for a little while and getting a small dose of that morning light while turning your thoughts to the Lord will do wonders for your mental health as you entrust whatever the day brings to Him.
.
Are you an early bird who enjoys the sunrises or fresh morning light? What is your morning routine?
.
“Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love,
 for I have put my trust in you.
Show me the way I should go,
 for to you I entrust my life.“
Psalm 143:8
.
.

While Gatorade is a staple at most sports games, there are some ingredients in that drink that are problematic. It may be a great way to replenish electrolytes, but the artificial colors, flavors, sweeteners, and preservatives are not beneficial for us or our kids.🙅🏼‍♀️

Friends, it’s super easy and inexpensive to make your own! This recipe is packed with vital electrolytes, minerals, and a fresh, sweet flavor using natural ingredients and sweeteners that are easier for the body to process. It’s delicious over ice, and you could even swap out the water for seltzer for a bubbly drink.😋

✨Healthy Sports Drink Recipe✨
In a 2 quart mason jar add the following:

1 cup coconut water
The juice from ½ a lime
The juice from ½ a lemon
½ tsp quality salt (such as Himalayan pink salt or Redmond Real Salt (@redmondrealsalt) - do NOT use iodized table salt in this drink)
½ Tablespoon honey
Fill the rest of the way with water and shake to combine.

Serve over ice and enjoy!

Have you ever tried a natural version of Gatorade? I know there are some options now at the store for healthier choices, but making it yourself always guarantees the ingredients and is more cost effective!

If you try this, let me know what you think!

Thank you @barefoot.mimosas for the recipe!
.
.
.

I have wanted to make my own vanilla extract for a long time, and when I finally got around to doing it I was kicking myself for not trying it sooner. It’s incredibly easy to put together, and the taste will be so much better than what is available at the store, in addition to being much less expensive and a great gift too!

All you need is 1-2 ounces of grade A or B vanilla beans and 80-100 proof vodka, along with a glass container that is able to seal tightly. 1 ounce of beans will need 1 cup of vodka.

Slice the vanilla beans lengthwise so the seeds are exposed (no need to slice all the way through the bean), place into glass container, add the vodka until beans are fully submerged, and seal the jar. Store out of direct sunlight and turn once a week. Can be used in as little as 8 weeks, but I suggest waiting at least 4 months for good flavor, and up to 12 months for really strong, deep flavor.

Additionally, as you use the extract from your container, you can refill with a little vodka each time to keep your container full and the beans submerged. If you don’t refill with vodka, remove the beans after you open the container to begin using the vanilla. Otherwise the beans may get slimy as they are exposed to air.

If you are adding vodka to the container, replace the beans after 1 year, as the extract will become less and less potent over time. If you have taken the beans out, the extract will last virtually indefinitely. Just remember to start a new batch when you are about 6 months away from using all of your extract!😉

Have you ever made your own vanilla extract?

.

I dare you to try not to google it now.🤣
.
After getting past the ads, most of the search results that appear describe the harm that fabric softener does to fabric, including causing buildup on fibers, reducing absorbancy of towels, and adding unnecessary fragrances and skin irritants. These can increase a person’s toxic load, which puts additional stress on our filtering organs (which are working hard already)!
.
It is so easy to ditch and replace fabric softener. Put down the dryer sheets too while you’re at it. And also check the ingredients of your laundry soap, because these can also add unwanted toxins and chemicals to your home - and there are many natural options available that are cost effective and more gentle to your body.
.
One of my favorite swaps for dryer sheets and fabric softener is 100% wool dryer balls with a drop of two of EOs. Try Eucalyptus and Lavender for a sweet and fresh aroma. There are also natural options for liquid softener, including white vinegar, and if you want to add fragrance try using a spoonful of epsom salts with a drop of essential oils for fragrance.

Have you made the swap yet?
.
.
.
#knowbetterdobetter #educateyourself #toxinfreefamily #toxinfreefamily #healthandwellness #healthyhome #naturalmama #naturalmom #crunchymama # crunchymom #ditchandswitch #healthychoices #healthyfamily #organicmama #organicmom #naturalmum #themoreyouknow #makehealthychoices

One of my first swaps when I started trying to get rid of unnecessary toxins in my home was replacing dryer sheets with wool dryer balls. They help to keep my laundry from getting wrinkled (leaving it on the couch after I take it out of the dryer on the other hand…😬) and they help me save money because I’m not buying dryer sheets, and my clothes dry faster.👏🏼👏🏼
.
A couple tips if you swap to dryer balls!
• While these can last for a very long time, when the top layer of wool starts coming loose be sure to replace your set
• Use 3 wool balls for small loads, 6 for larger loads
• Reduce the drying time for your clothes to eliminate static (caused by over drying)
• apply essential oils (optional) during the last 10 minutes of the drying cycle to add a gentle natural fragrance to your clothes
• Refresh your dryer balls every so often by putting them in the wash on hot and then drying them in the dryer afterward.
.
Have you ever used dryer balls? The one in this reel are from @oil.life 😄
.
.
.

“For thus said the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, “In returning and rest you shall be saved; in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.”
‭‭Isaiah‬ ‭30‬:‭15‬

We are told in so many ways that a busy life is a full life.

There is nothing wrong with work. God gives each of us work to do, but so many times I find myself piling more on my plate than what He has assigned to me at the time.

I have to be careful to pray before I volunteer for a new project, before I give time and attention to people and commitments that might take away from the primary work and responsibilities that the Lord has given to me.

It’s easy to be distracted by what everyone else is doing and feel like I need to keep up. But what is truly important is what God has told me to do. It might look different than what everyone else is doing, what other people think is important. But the only thing that matters is walking in obedience as the Lord leads.

Sometimes distractions push their way in, and I have to refocus my time and attention on what falls in line with my priorities. Even if that means turning off social media, waiting to respond to messages and texts, putting down a project with lesser priority so I can give my attention to my husband or family or home, or whatever it is that the Lord has placed before me in that moment. Being willing to let go of what I thought my day would look like and submitting my will to the Lord’s moment by moment. Seeking Him in all this continually.

I’ve had to learn to let go of a lot the last few years to be able to be still and quiet to hear the Lord’s quiet voice through all the noise of the world around me. And I am thankful for the gift of stillness and rest that has come with letting go.

What is the Lord asking you to choose today? Are you in the habit of being still and asking the Lord what He wants you to do with your time and energy each day? What an amazing gift it is to be able to ask our Creator for wisdom to know how to live in the ways He knows is best for us. I pray God gives you clarity and peace as you seek Him.

Last summer I was chatting with some friends about turmeric and one of them shared that when she took turmeric supplements, they actually caused more pain and discomfort in her joints that usually only occurs when she’s in a flare from her autoimmune concerns.

We’ve heard for a while now about how great turmeric can be for reducing inflammation, and in many cases small amounts of turmeric can be beneficial. However, in larger amounts, curcumin (one of the active compounds in turmeric) can actually make autoimmune symptoms worse.

After the conversation with my friend, I also stopped taking the turmeric supplements I had been using (these contained a highly concentrated amount of turmeric) and in the last 4 months since I’ve stopped using them I’ve seen my own auto immune symptoms improve tremendously.

Since insta doesn’t allow links in captions, comment below if you’d like the link to the study that elaborates on this information!

What’s right for your body might not be right for *every* body. It’s so important to pay attention to how you are feeling, especially when starting a new supplement. And not just the next day, but monitor yourself on an ongoing basis to see if you feel better or worse long term.

Have you ever experienced this from turmeric or other supplements? Share your thoughts!
.
.
.

“Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, in everything give thanks.” 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18

What a gift it is to be able to give thanks, no matter what the circumstance may be.

Giving thanks, not just for tradition’s sake, but regularly, intentionally - not to an impersonal universe, but to its Creator who knows us, who knows every hair on our heads, who places us in situations and relationships for a purpose - is a balm for the soul. Even when the path has more questions than answers, when the way ahead is unclear, in times of grief or loneliness, in the long and weary seasons when prayers seem to go unanswered, there is truth that brings to recollection the overwhelming mercy and grace that has already been given. Gratitude is the response to undeserved kindness and love poured out in Christ Jesus.

Gratitude fuels faith in the One who brings us new days, new breath, new opportunities to learn and grow and know Him better. Gratitude for what has been done reminds us to wait with patient expectation for the work He is still doing and the fulfillment of His promises.

“Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow due to change.” James 1:17

Today as I reflect on the practice of thankfulness, I realize that this too is a good gift from God I get to participate in over and over again. Road markers on my journey that remind me of His faithfulness and encourage me to keep seeking Jesus every day, to keep asking for wisdom, direction, and understanding to know how to honor Him with these good gifts He has given.

I pray your faith would also be encouraged as you give thanks to our great God for the good things He has placed in your life. That your faith would be strengthened, and that you would also have wisdom to know how to best use these good things. That as your faith is strengthened, your worry, fear, grief, sorrow, would be overwhelmed by His peace and love that are without measure and beyond understanding.

Happy Thanksgiving from my family to yours. Each of you is a good gift and I am so thankful for you and the connection that God has given us in this corner of social media❤️🍁
